bow: thoughts you should have about your children sorry if it feels too personal but my wife thinks she is bad mother for dying little inside when she hears our baby wake up lol so just wanted to see alone love my daughter love spending time with her she is about the best part of my day every day but first thing in the morning and first thing after her nap in the afternoon my thought is always please go back to sleep need little more sleep down time for sure it does mean love him less just like sleep lol it crazy common haha free time is so hard to get feel that way too sometimes ll be watching tv or eating my first meal of the day at pm and look down to two little eyes staring up and think nooooo not yet fuckkkkkk if that the worst she got she doing amazing haha the minute realized my twins naps weren going to overlap even minute this morning was tiny moment of despair was gon na shower think they re normal but we ve also got to keep an idea on them veryyyy common love my child love to cuddle but also love my alone time unfortunately there stigma in regards to being honest about what motherhood is really like do this all the time grateful he wakes up of course but there always that ugh already needed more time to do nothing have to tell myself not to throw my kids in the dumpster on near daily basis she not alone and sure every mom has rolled over and groaned ugh go back to sleep kid at least once in their mom hood ugh so common when the baby wakes up early or at night my sigh sucks the air out of the room not bad mom at all love being mom and have complaints my baby is good sleeper still think this whenever he wakes up removed completely normal give her hug for me and all will get used to it to having baby to being needed there was hole in heart didn know had until my kid was born but didn reach that conclusion for while my husband and love our sons we still ask ourselves at least once day why we had them and is it too late to leave them at the fire station my son woke up early this morning and was asking about his dreams he had would not stop talking may or may not have told him to go watch his tablet or do something else the mom guilt is real by sunday afternoon often so ready for daycare on monday know that sounds terrible but my nerves just seem to be shot by then my husband and used to joke about dropping off our lo at the fire station when she was first born she was colicky and would only sleep on me or would only take 30min naps in her crib for the first months of her life to say we were stressed would be an understatement making jokes like that made us feel better and relieve some of the tension also used to occasionally sing the prom night dumpster baby song from family guy to my lo because found it hilarious and she was too young to parrot back words yet oh hell no have no idea how many times ve banged my head into my pillow or just whispered fuuuuuck when heard my lo crying for the millionth time in the night love my girl more than anything she an adorable sweet little toddler now that does stop me from occasionally walking away and punching pillow when she truly frustrates me always make sure she knows that mama loves her even if get angry sometimes when she being difficult every meal is battle ugh swallowing anger and bottling it up is recipe for disaster my favorite time of the day is when put my daughter down for bed that means get some quiet time with myself and my husband hen get in bed and snuggle into my blankets for peaceful sleep it amazing she is amazing but not just mom but person also and dammit do love some peaches and quite while read book soon after my second was born went to the psychiatrist because when they both would cry at the same time would think about what it would be like to just walk out the door and not come back her response yeah that normal don you know anyone else with two kids always looking forward to nap time and bed time it my time me to unwind and relax nobody should feel guilty for wanting break away from the kid appreciate it when my husband takes my son out during the day without me if you have done it for your wife you totally should to have the house to yourself for bit is like dream come true lol sometimes we just say we did this to ourself like on purpose wtf were we thinking it not common thing that moms openly discuss because it highly stigmatized but all moms have moments where they wish their child would go back to sleep leave them alone or even for moment wish they never had children we still love them but it hard to have little helpless person depend on you your wife is normal and should not feel guilty at all she doing great job love my kids so much but sometimes my favorite part of the morning is when drop them off at daycare in my experience kids naps are just never ever long enough my husband and sometimes joke about being able to put the toddlers nap on pause for an extra hour or five hahaha love my toddler more than life but that want for extra time to yourself is so normal people keep telling me one day they ll get up on their own and make themselves bowl of cereal we shall see hahaha childhood is fleeting because very few parents could handle any of its phases for any longer than they already last if kids were kids for 20 or 30 years our species would ve died out millennia ago come back and talk to me when she starts wanting to bite things cause she so exhausted all the time sometimes pretend still asleep while silently praying he goes and reads book for 20 min this does make me bad mom it makes me an exhausted human who alarm clock has no snooze feature divorced mommy my ex has our son days week non consecutive when my son was baby would cry my eyes out now do little dance need that time it makes me better mother to have downtime honestly think it would be more unusual if she *didn t* have those reactions parenthood is hard you lose much of your autonomy and it only natural to struggle
